title: Capitol Report Day 34 03/21/25
summary:
## Overview

The Georgia legislature session focused on the debate and passage of Senate Bill 68, a controversial tort reform bill that included an exception for victims of human trafficking. The session featured a failed amendment to extend protections to children and the elderly, as well as concerns raised by a Republican senator about the bill being an "insurance company bailout."

## Key Actions

**SB 68**: Tort reform bill, passed 34-21.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)

No new bills were introduced.

## Notable Moments

- Attempted amendment to extend protections to children and the elderly failed.
- Senator Colton Moore, a Republican, criticized the bill as an "insurance company bailout" with no guarantees of lower rates.
- Governor Brian Kemp praised the legislature's work on the "tough issue."

## Votes

**SB 68**: Passed 34-21.

## Attendance

No quorum issues noted.

## Adjournment

Lawmakers will return on Tuesday for day 35 of the session.
